titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Peter Mahoney papers 1986.050
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:20:11 +0000.

did.abstract: Two life insurance certificates and one stock certificate issued to Peter Mahoney, along with corresponding letters and envelopes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Peter Mahoney papers, 1986.050, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Peter Mahoney was a Brooklyn attorney who had an office at 69 Broadway and resided at 604 or 609 Lafayette Avenue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two life insurance certificates and one stock certificate issued to Peter Mahoney, along with corresponding letters and envelopes.
